examples: … a countenance which expressed both good humor and intelligence …
… startled, and also somewhat out of countenance.
He managed to keep his countenance through the ordeal.

definition: face, visage, the face as an indication of mood, emotion, or character
examples: The photograph showed his somber countenance.

definition: bearing or expression that offers approval or sanction : moral support
examples: … her countenance of their unsafe amusements …

definition: to extend approval or toleration to : sanction
examples: refused to countenance any changes in the policy
